Watch kaiji instead of this
this is so much better, I'm sad they decided to stop this and started making that nonsense about a kid who only loses
hmm I feel like this was eh, kaiji was great thriller with good development
I just dont get Kaiji, its's just about a boy that loses, even when he wins, something happens and he still loses,

Its not like that, its a thriller where he gets to know the world, if you ever gambled on high amounts you would know. He develops a lot throughout and I liked how he became strong but then he loses again. I am not the type of guy who minds weak char if they have good development.
he climbs to the top of the hill, he gets shoved off, he tries harder and climbs to the top of the cliff, he gets shoved off, he tries EVEN harder and climbs a mountain......he gets shoved off....
Mate, it's a gambling story. He can't always win or always lose. It would just be dumb and it would lose the tension. Just look at Kakegurui

But he does always lose...or at least when it matters, He loses but "survives"...as you say. "It would just be dumb and it would lose the tension", there's an underlining "understanding" that the MC has plot armor, there is no real tension there, I'd rather see the MC always win than always lose. The only thing Kakegurui has in common is that it's about gambling, and she doesn't lose ALL the time.

Also, in my opinion Kakegurui is a good anime, but a bad GAMBLING anime. You can't make a gambling anime where she only loses if she purposefully throws, she either wins or ties. They removed all sorts of tension and stakes when they showed that she had more than enough money to buy her status out (I forgot how it was called), and she was only in to play with the best players in the School.
I just get the feeling that gambling anime isn't really for u, and that's okay
What a shitty cope out from a discussion.

You don't get it bruh? Who are you to decide what really is for him or not? You only said that because you couldn't engage his point convincingly and decided the only alternative you had was to say ''Oh well, the only reason you say these things is because it's not for you, I win gg no re''. That's called a shitty cope out lol. Seeyanara, I'm out :P

Just said what I thought tho
Ok

I dont need YOU to tell ME what my taste is, I love Kakegurui and Akagi, and I saw the first Kaiji and I thought it was utter garbage because it really was just about a guy that trips at the finish line. And keeping the title of "survivor" tends to mean he isn't winning, but barely not losing ALL of it.
Still, that just reinforced that you don't really like gambling, you like character development, not that there's much in kakegurui, but yeah

You do know that there is never going to be a "Gambling" anime in it's true sense? All anime is a form of story and most stories, as I have said, MCs have plot armor. There aren't that many surprises. The only things different is HOW things unfold. How Jabami is going to win this weird game? How is Akagi going to surpass this opponent? All I get from Kaiji is How he is going to lose this time? How is he going to not quite get there?...

yes, I am aware, even though there are some nice anime that actually portray gambling quite well, all I'm saying is that in my opinion, Akagi and Kakegurui aren't really good GAMBLING anime, you never considered if jabami would lose, or if akagi would, and I'll keep saying that because kaiji does end up winning some times, but not all, he gets backstabbed, he get's tricked, he doesn't always know how to get past the rigged games he is presented with, and I personally find that great. If you didn't, then that's okay, I just said that he couldn't always win or lose, and that kakegurui is a bad gambling anime
Chillax my guy, I just said what I thought, sry if it offended you or something. But yeah, just watch s2 or something, because there's not just losing
Does he get to the end, tries something fancy, and then the house wins again?
You gotta see for yourself
the fact that you can't tell me no says a lot
I just don't wanna spoil it
actually, screw it, he wins BIG several times
If you tell me that he always loses, then it just means that you haven't watched it all, just read the manga or watch it until the end

no, it was awhile back but I literally can't finish the anime (and not for a lack of trying), it's like he's just flourishing in a fish bowl and at any given time, someone would reach in and muck it up if he gets too good, at least with Akagi, like most decent/good shows, he actually conquers the obstacles that he comes across.

I did watch One Outs and I think it was great, once again, the MC actually conquers the obstacles that he is presented, Kaiji is just not, just as his title, he just survives his obstacles and he's back in the same position.
I kind of get that
once again, it's not for lack of trying, but I'm not going to enjoying watching a guy just keep losing on progressingly larger stages
oh I see, I personally liked how he struggled lol but I get that

I dont mind the struggle, there just doesn't seem to have anything to show for it. like Shield Hero had his struggle, but he was able to become the strongest hero because of it. what I can see with Kaiji, it's just struggle then lose, different environment, struggle then lose, rinse and repeat.
hmm I didn't mind those struggles even he was losing because it all felt real, this is what actually happens in gambling tbh
No it's not. Kaiji was all about manipulation and exploitation of rules. Nothing that happens in Kaiji is comparable to real gambling.

Agreed and disagreed. Loved how it shows the darker side of gambling and how every game is rigged from the start. You just look at how and if he notices and tries to get around it. But idk about you, but I don't think I've ever played a gambling game that wasn't rigged or completely fair from the start, that's what's so great about gambling in general, youre either the one that exploits the other or others, or the one that gets exploited

In gambling in the real world, you're always the one getting exploited, unless you're the one hosting the game. Whether it's casinos or bookies or market makers, they use statistics to create riskless positions for themselves where no matter how you play, they're always making money while you play. They're extremely keen on tracking the games and working out when they might have overlooked any type of advantage that was accidentally given to the player, and they'll revise the games to avoid them. You either play by the house rules, or you don't play at all. Sometimes competing bookies will offer different spreads or odds and create temporary arbitrage opportunities, but again you're never winning against them because they're making their money on fees.
